4C43275B7FDB41FC9510700125A19FBB.description: Educators comply with rules, policies, and standards of ethical practice.

ADAD96CAD4B3488391FEC3352A3B2EDE.description:
Educators respond to cultural and personal frames of reference when
teaching students with gifts and talents.

F83AE2B1011B40A390512C5C5CDD2AB4.description:
Ethics - Students develop their gifts and
talents as a result of educators who are ethical in
their practices.

6A7E5821543B45F9BD5CDAD50C3060BB.description:
Educators identify and address areas for personal growth for teaching
students with gifts and talents in their professional development plans.

C6739DCA9164428CB9B31015B670D87F.description:
Educators use multiple modes of professional development delivery
including online courses, online and electronic communities, face-to-face
workshops, professional learning communities, and book talks.

55A94CA11818459D8FBDCA0CFBECB336.description:
Educators participate in professional development that is sustained over
time, that includes regular follow-up, and that seeks evidence of impact on
teacher practice and on student learning.

F0534B28404B444789F67D3D3E11BCC3.description:
Educators assess their instructional practices and continue their
education in school district staff development, professional organizations, and
higher education settings based on these assessments.

FE776A56D3E84D68AAD3B3733C3993F3.description:
Lifelong Learners - Students develop their
gifts and talents as a result of educators who are
life-long learners, participating in ongoing
professional development and continuing
education opportunities.

19E50F7C30DC4D54B9F6C760E57A9A6E.description:
Educators participate in ongoing professional development to support the
social and emotional needs of students with gifts and talents.

D01B0E9C3D924341B7591D0D2B4556C9.description:
Socio-emotional Development - Students with
gifts and talents develop socially and emotionally
as a result of educators who have participated in
professional development aligned with national
standards in gifted education and National Staff
Development Standards.

6E224697EB8F48EDA5AE71668E3E6D2D.description:
Educators use their awareness of organizations and publications relevant
to gifted education to promote learning for students with gifts and talents.

B90A574B7E354309BBBAA281FC9F6468.description:
Administrators provide human and material resources needed for
professional development in gifted education (e.g. release time, funding for
continuing education, substitute support, webinars, or mentors).

B9BCDC0238964DE2BFB93FBC8012E9A1.description:
Educators participate in ongoing professional development addressing
key issues such as anti-intellectualism and trends in gifted education such as
equity and access.

F2D06800AD2541A9B98285670F584AA5.description:
The school district provides professional development for teachers that
models how to develop environments and instructional activities that encourage
students to express diverse characteristics and behaviors that are associated
with giftedness.

203BB124C147479EA63EE7A2DCF93DE5.description:
Educators systematically participate in ongoing, research-supported
professional development that addresses the foundations of gifted education,
characteristics of students with gifts and talents, assessment, curriculum
planning and instruction, learning environments, and programming.

9D7F60C2AAFA40BE90A85A2E8C1621FD.description:
Talent Development - Students develop their
talents and gifts as a result of interacting with
educators who meet the national teacher
preparation standards in gifted education.

CAF9361DCE0E4C45A8C915E17FD901C9.description:
Educators facilitate mentorships, internships, and vocational programming
experiences that match student interests and aptitudes.

E966D67BC6A6404EBD5951BD0412FBFC.description:
Educators provide professional guidance and counseling for individual
student strengths, interests, and values.

AB43F2ADAA1D410AA7B7658679F43394.description:
Career Pathways - Students with gifts and
talents identify future career goals and the talent
development pathways to reach those goals.

2E37DD1134A445E9B615DC016453A1C6.description:
Educators create policies and procedures to guide and sustain all
components of the program, including assessment, identification, acceleration
practices, and grouping practices, that is built on an evidence-based foundation
in gifted education.

6F20E87CCCA847669116703384EEA65D.description:
Policies and Procedures - Students with gifts
and talents participate in regular and gifted
education programs that are guided by clear
policies and procedures that provide for their
advanced learning needs (e.g., early entrance,
acceleration, credit in lieu of enrollment).

94439749C69045988C23BAB2C012DB2C.description:
Educators develop thoughtful, multi-year program plans in relevant student
talent areas, PK-12.

3E4E075ACC6C40BD9B5CA744B7F94DCA.description:
Comprehensiveness - Students with gifts and
talents develop their potential through
comprehensive, aligned programming and services.

01E3E46D3FC04310B22B9F6D83AE8C47.description:
Administrators track expenditures at the school level to verify appropriate
and sufficient funding for gifted programming and services.

52CC1D401CB440A58B85C68E5F071206.description:
Resources - Students with gifts and talents
participate in gifted education programming that is
adequately funded to meet student needs and
program goals.

91B45422BF0842ECB8927B9158B88B47.description:
Educators regularly engage families and community members for
planning, programming, evaluating, and advocating.

DC8FF730918447E7A89821B5D960AA28.description:
Collaboration - Students with gifts and talents’
learning is enhanced by regular collaboration
among families, community, and the school.

3FAE33C67677448EBF96D5AA74E307D2.description:
Educators in gifted, general, and special education programs, as well as
those in specialized areas, collaboratively plan, develop, and implement services
for learners with gifts and talents.

338C01765C7D483EBEBD1A200043A0C4.description:
Coordinated Services - Students with gifts and
talents demonstrate progress as a result of the
shared commitment and coordinated services of
gifted education, general education, special
education, and related professional services, such
as school counselors, school psychologists, and
social workers.

24BA0383EC2448989268194640D3D702.description:
Administrators demonstrate support for gifted programs through equitable
allocation of resources and demonstrated willingness to ensure that learners with
gifts and talents receive appropriate educational services.

650656F5D0394A27A5D559C7B71ED529.description:
Educators regularly use current technologies, including online learning
options and assistive technologies to enhance access to high-level
programming.

0F1E1EA4A16A40619A5A82891F5E30F7.description:
Educators regularly use individualized learning options such as
mentorships, internships, online courses, and independent study.

52513DE203B442188AEA361BE85EBC95.description:
Educators regularly use multiple forms of grouping, including clusters,
resource rooms, special classes, or special schools.

0200A5A3FEDA4E2AAA39FC75B8F799CD.description:
Educators regularly use enrichment options to extend and deepen learning
opportunities within and outside of the school setting.

2D628DA7F8CC48F2ADED0B7B217729D2.description:
Educators regularly use multiple alternative approaches to accelerate
learning.

8924C7DFE97B4A86BC596EE26F6419C7.description:
Variety of Programming - Students with gifts
and talents participate in a variety of evidence based programming options that enhance
performance in cognitive and affective areas.

36594B929D97483EACD446E7FB38E1D8.description:
Educators ensure access to advanced communication tools, including
assistive technologies, and use of these tools for expressing higher-level
thinking and creative productivity

349884CDF44E4CF3A86BD7B79ED24107.description:
Educators provide resources to enhance oral, written, and artistic forms
of communication, recognizing students’ cultural context.

F0EB6C29DF674524BA82C5864684190F.description:
Educators provide opportunities for advanced development and
maintenance of first and second language(s).

0C07458DDE3C4378B7ECA8BDC5B6B518.description:
Communication Competence - Students with
gifts and talents develop competence in
interpersonal and technical communication skills.
They demonstrate advanced oral and written skills,
balanced biliteracy or multiliteracy, and creative
expression. They display fluency with technologies
that support effective communication.

E29E8CF9E96D44B88DE28CA03AFB00DF.description:
Educators provide structured opportunities to collaborate with diverse
peers on a common goal.

415B997EE29A49CD8BBDDF7C9C2B00EA.description:
Educators censure discriminatory language and behavior and model
appropriate strategies.

DDABFC13646D4246B466FC3AE812705C.description:
Educators model appreciation for and sensitivity to students’ diverse
backgrounds and languages.

04C23340D0B841EAAEB79B38E4C831F4.description:
Cultural Competence - Students with gifts and
talents value their own and others’ language,
heritage, and circumstance. They possess skills in
communicating, teaming, and collaborating with
diverse individuals and across diverse groups.
1
They use positive strategies to address social
issues, including discrimination and stereotyping.

12D99A9CC3104D10B7D8949879EFE69E.description:
Educators promote opportunities for leadership in community settings to
effect positive change.

0CB1C80EAF0E4F9A98DDBCD9F81C760F.description:
Educators provide environments for developing many forms of
leadership and leadership skills.

1B2997AFA2B24FEC860306582ECD7947.description:
Educators establish a safe and welcoming climate for addressing social
issues and developing personal responsibility.

7F0F577D1A9449CDB5670355F40A2B2C.description:
Leadership - Students with gifts and talents
demonstrate personal and social responsibility and
leadership skills.

EFFE868384C448E7830615160E9CA454.description:
Educators assess and provide instruction on social skills needed for
school, community, and the world of work.

F8BB8B30B9114725B0531170D8EA897D.description:
Educators provide opportunities for interaction with intellectual and
artistic/creative peers as well as with chronological-age peers.

BCEDB383A3124D0EB3F202CE939F8310.description:
Educators understand the needs of students with gifts and talents for
both solitude and social interaction.

17F5FE7D40DC499DBE48A1A688F65BAB.description:
Social Competence - Students with gifts and
talents develop social competence manifested in
positive peer relationships and social interactions.

3436C7928EBF4376B4979611F9A0046E.description:
Educators provide examples of positive coping skills and opportunities to
apply them.

A48FA845AD4D4100BA5C8E95EC4966E0.description:
Educators provide feedback that focuses on effort, on evidence of
potential to meet high standards, and on mistakes as learning opportunities.

A15D85A109EE44A4AE84AE44348BBA59.description:
Educators create environments that support trust among diverse
learners.

EC80EE11DDD84E27BEAFC7CA6FF597E0.description:
Educators provide opportunities for self-exploration, development and
pursuit of interests, and development of identities supportive of achievement,
e.g., through mentors and role models.

4C9A3A6C149A4CE5BED11AD51F29D829.description:
Educators maintain high expectations for all students with gifts and
talents as evidenced in meaningful and challenging activities.

2D17D8B9456B401FA1BE3706C5A26A97.description:
Personal Competence - Students with gifts and
talents demonstrate growth in personal
competence and dispositions for exceptional
academic and creative productivity. These include
self-awareness, self-advocacy, self-efficacy,
confidence, motivation, resilience, independence,
curiosity, and risk taking.

80921265D6E34B39991A1CB482B54201.description:
Teachers and administrators demonstrate familiarity with sources for
high quality resources and materials that are appropriate for learners with gifts
and talents.

A28C9823D8D646FC966465EA22A50AA3.description:
Resources - Students with gifts and talents
benefit from gifted education programming that
provides a variety of high quality resources and
materials.

2D1825D8F1884FA28E345FEE93D23567.description:
Educators use curriculum for deep explorations of cultures, languages,
and social issues related to diversity.

A4E0C935E46A4E89ACD2C8F5C8765AD0.description:
Educators integrate career exploration experiences into learning
opportunities for students with gifts and talents, e.g. biography study or
speakers.

7D4F04021A8847B89BC67F3DDB5CCE91.description:
Educators develop and use challenging, culturally responsive curriculum
to engage all students with gifts and talents.

28B6AC0BE81140DBB2274A9654829C13.description:
Culturally Relevant Curriculum - Students with
gifts and talents develop knowledge and skills for
living and being productive in a multicultural,
diverse, and global society

310A70CBDEF0452790DC61E87705CA94.description:
Educators use inquiry models to meet the needs of students with gifts
and talents.

C5BD8B5D9946414AA5B1AD9C509E65CA.description:
Educators use problem-solving model strategies to meet the needs of
students with gifts and talents.

1A03857A67434879BAB47935467E91A2.description:
Educators use creative-thinking strategies to meet the needs of students
with gifts and talents.

51B7E1C94850461ABBF19DCB512C4CBF.description:
Educators use critical-thinking strategies to meet the needs of students
with gifts and talents.

1FECEB524C3B4F72B270247C81439524.description:
Instructional Strategies - Students with gifts
and talents become independent investigators.

7F10B052A2744AE9BC41CB84D167F71A.description:
Educators provide opportunities for students with gifts and talents to
explore, develop, or research their areas of interest and/or talent.

6E04906BBD3D4E1BA3BA0C94CBAB4C9F.description:
Educators use school and community resources that support
differentiation.

32CA186170814428B33CE06ED18AA823.description:
Educators select, adapt, and use a repertoire of instructional strategies
and materials that differentiate for students with gifts and talents and that
respond to diversity.

E51A173D811741A584E2E6B96D7AB88B.description:
Talent Development - Students with gifts and
talents develop their abilities in their domain of
talent and/or area of interest.

499436745A0F46E893AE2E33E1F48F0D.description:
Educators use metacognitive models to meet the needs of students with
gifts and talents.

D2D0324B88564957BE97DAC5E46869FA.description:
Educators design curricula in cognitive, affective, aesthetic, social, and
leadership domains that are challenging and effective for students with gifts
and talents.

96F22B5FE026494BB6CBDF2F76FEB0E6.description:
Talent Development - Students with gifts and
talents become more competent in multiple talent
areas and across dimensions of learning.

1A76B25CF41649FAB85991667404B358.description:
Educators use information and technologies, including assistive
technologies, to individualize for students with gifts and talents, including those
who are twice-exceptional.

6BAC97563CD24AD3A94F57D9B4FC5D56.description:
Educators use pre-assessments and pace instruction based on the
learning rates of students with gifts and talents and accelerate and compact
learning as appropriate.

8185C1D967F145C8B927E7852358B971.description:
Educators use a balanced assessment system, including preassessment
and formative assessment, to identify students’ needs, develop
differentiated education plans, and adjust plans based on continual progress
monitoring.

AAA85A1F7BD243B6A195F916F2EDB69D.description:
Educators design differentiated curricula that incorporate advanced,
conceptually challenging, in-depth, distinctive, and complex content for
students with gifts and talents.

08E9E41F361248B4B523F661C5E62007.description:
Educators adapt, modify, or replace the core or standard curriculum to
meet the needs of students with gifts and talents and those with special needs
such as twice-exceptional, highly gifted, and English language learners.

806148469EFF478B9BFBDDFA58DA7214.description:
Educators design and use a comprehensive and continuous scope and
sequence to develop differentiated plans for PK-12 students with gifts and
talents.

D72881FE942144C1BB18FD7BFA806805.description:
Educators use local, state, and national standards to align and expand
curriculum and instructional plans.

B455B4E64A88480C99B66E2AE80BB3CE.description:
Curriculum Planning - Students with gifts and
talents demonstrate growth commensurate with
aptitude during the school year.

CD3DD5DF5917493DB06FE908E511DFB4.description:
Educators disseminate the results of the evaluation, orally and in written
form, and explain how they will use the results.

A7ADD2A3FBE14D71BDF4FC85FFCF4E49.description:
The evaluation plan is purposeful and evaluates how student-level
outcomes are influenced by one or more of the following components of gifted
education programming: (a) identification, (b) curriculum, (c) instructional
programming and services, (d) ongoing assessment of student learning, (e)
counseling and guidance programs, (f) teacher qualifications and professional
development, (g) parent/guardian and community involvement, (h)
programming resources, and (i) programming design, management, and
delivery.

01A623CE11FB43D9BE97F830BFF61A85.description:
Administrators provide the necessary time and resources to implement
an annual evaluation plan developed by persons with expertise in program
evaluation and gifted education.

248CF88B50A4442AA854F543A01A618C.description:
Evaluation of Programming - Students
identified with gifts and talents have increased
access and they show significant learning
progress as a result of improving components of
gifted education programming.

8DB62F8CD33F4FD9AEB6C4AECCE21227.description:
Educators assess the quantity, quality, and appropriateness of the
programming and services provided for students with gifts and talents by
disaggregating assessment data and yearly progress data and making the
results public.

2F700101F23947D683FF167B3632AE25.description:
Educators ensure that the assessment of the progress of students with
gifts and talents uses multiple indicators that measure mastery of content,
higher level thinking skills, achievement in specific program areas, and
affective growth.

D8D6F4C07CEF420BBF0F423B3C2B5908.description:
Educators ensure that the assessments used in the identification and
evaluation processes are reliable and valid for each instrument’s purpose,
allow for above-grade-level performance, and allow for diverse perspectives.

572DC1713E5B43D3A4E36F06AE4613D0.description:
Evaluation of Programming -Students
identified with gifts and talents demonstrate
important learning progress as a result of
programming and services.

9991657ADC4F4DDE9C6A7CB4F5098F14.description:
Educators communicate and interpret assessment information to
students with gifts and talents and their parents/guardians.

02EFB184B2724B2BA772A51C0572A3C4.description:
Educators use and interpret qualitative and quantitative assessment
information to develop a profile of the strengths and weaknesses of each
student with gifts and talents to plan appropriate intervention.

D2FBA4A11BF844288B488FD9973B21A4.description:
Educators use off-level standardized assessments to measure the
progress of students with gifts and talents.

2D3D45C110F14F799F177FA6D7B43AC4.description:
Educators use differentiated product-based assessments to measure the
progress of students with gifts and talents.

D62C1962942E4EE982E3BA5FBB03E41A.description:
Educators use differentiated pre- and post- performance-based
assessments to measure the progress of students with gifts and talents.

C78E1F134B8A44D494E71A96B42A3208.description:
Learning Progress and Outcomes - Students
with gifts and talents demonstrate advanced and
complex learning as a result of using multiple,
appropriate, and ongoing assessments.

C616F6DECA454CDCBCEE4FC1BC2CB4B2.description:
Educators provide parents/guardians with information in their native
language regarding diverse behaviors and characteristics that are associated
with giftedness and with information that explains the nature and purpose of
gifted programming options.

0A5CD84749EB43AB963CD5A9BCCE72E1.description:
Educators understand and implement district and state policies designed
to foster equity in gifted programming and services.

AC193C0E93154F59BF8CCF3385C63CA3.description:
Educators select and use non-biased and equitable approaches for
identifying students with gifts and talents, which may include using locally
developed norms or assessment tools in the child’s native language or in
nonverbal formats.

81AB3FC31AF843358477CBAEF6FD324C.description:
Identification - Students with identified needs
represent diverse backgrounds and reflect the
total student population of the district.

8952776184234E33AD5129C9A26CF3E8.description:
Educators inform all parents/guardians about the identification process.
Teachers obtain parental/guardian permission for assessments, use culturally
sensitive checklists, and elicit evidence regarding the child’s interests and
potential outside of the classroom setting.

C729D2F2537E4189AA7D9FFCA574EB78.description:
Educators interpret multiple assessments in different domains and
understand the uses and limitations of the assessments in identifying the
needs of students with gifts and talents.

EA2B209260BA4D3D9DE783C8BABC0FDB.description:
Educators have knowledge of student exceptionalities and collect
assessment data while adjusting curriculum and instruction to learn about each
student’s developmental level and aptitude for learning.

61DFC18480024F95B99E4B710A5D0A2D.description:
Assessments provide qualitative and quantitative information from a
variety of sources, including off-level testing, are nonbiased and equitable, and
are technically adequate for the purpose.

7CDBA964B976444397499CFAA4D28DD2.description:
Educators select and use multiple assessments that measure diverse
abilities, talents, and strengths that are based on current theories, models, and
research.

D90EADD8A8244C13A8063058774B749A.description:
Educators establish comprehensive, cohesive, and ongoing procedures
for identifying and serving students with gifts and talents. These provisions
include informed consent, committee review, student retention, student
reassessment, student exiting, and appeals procedures for both entry and exit
from gifted program services.

3C8F729100614CE680C568901785E82F.description:
Identification - Each student reveals his or her
exceptionalities or potential through assessment
evidence so that appropriate instructional
accommodations and modifications can be
provided.

3D82CF27D91F44B287F8F80C9015244B.description:
Educators provide parents/guardians with information regarding diverse
characteristics and behaviors that are associated with giftedness.

BB8FE071EB284F689CDFE5089552E769.description:
Educators develop environments and instructional activities that
encourage students to express diverse characteristics and behaviors that are
associated with giftedness.

5AE09628F71141F2B9BE321F56D37A66.description:
Identification - All students in grades PK-12
have equal access to a comprehensive
assessment system that allows them to
demonstrate diverse characteristics and behaviors
that are associated with giftedness.

5927EEDEC4964D889A6F04E7BC04EC28.description:
Teachers and counselors implement a curriculum scope and sequence
that contains person/social awareness and adjustment, academic planning,
and vocational and career awareness.

BE2F829CA20F4925B55AFC630D90C3B4.description:
Educators provide students with college and career guidance that is
consistent with their strengths.

88C7FA0212D4466FB318D53F8EBFE1DB.description:
Cognitive and Affective Growth - Students with
gifts and talents identify future career goals that
match their talents and abilities and resources
needed to meet those goals (e.g., higher education
opportunities, mentors, financial support).

003FEB8DE606439A80DF108977DC2208.description:
Teachers enable students to identify their preferred approaches to
learning, accommodate these preferences, and expand them.

6D4B1C87FFE748ED8BD6BEC1DEA899A1.description:
Cognitive and Affective Growth - Students with
gifts and talents recognize their preferred
approaches to learning and expand their repertoire.

20A75DDD8CCE4C8E9BEDB9E43686DC78.description:
Educators develop specialized intervention services for students with
gifts and talents who are underachieving and are now learning and developing
their talents.

D1C69377ED2E46B2A899F9D17EB2DA13.description:
Educators design interventions for students to develop cognitive and
affective growth that is based on research of effective practices.

2316277874FF4FA6B583D559B6511AC8.description:
Cognitive and Affective Growth - Students with
gifts and talents benefit from meaningful and
challenging learning activities addressing their
unique characteristics and needs.

8E52601E160448EDA0A009A2FFDFADF8.description:
Educators collaborate with families in accessing resources to develop
their child’s talents

D7350C73DB114A9A9AD5823DD16854B1.description:
Awareness of Needs - Students’ families and
communities understand similarities and
differences with respect to the development and
characteristics of advanced and typical learners
and support students with gifts and talents’ needs.

91922504EFDE46D182640AD68B6D6C52.description:
Educators identify out-of-school learning opportunities that match
students’ abilities and interests.

4157D7E0B575411CA5A355D516A86CDC.description:
Educators provide role models (e.g., through mentors, bibliotherapy) for
students with gifts and talents that match their abilities and interests1.

7542C1ACA23B497B918DD83E879781BF.description:
Awareness of Needs - Students with gifts and
talents access resources from the community to
support cognitive and affective needs, including
social interactions with others having similar
interests and abilities or experiences, including
same-age peers and mentors or experts.

B8BE8CCDCB3B4869B814558FDC08910B.description:
Educators model respect for individuals with diverse abilities, strengths,
and goals.

4BDAA1E3A0AC4EB9A66302E3FE7EC7C1.description:
Educators provide a variety of research-based grouping practices for
students with gifts and talents that allow them to interact with individuals of
various gifts, talents, abilities, and strengths.

0EE1521FDFBF4FD080313BE0B877038F.description:
Self-Understanding - Students with gifts and
talents demonstrate understanding of and respect
for similarities and differences between themselves
and their peer group and others in the general
population.

8F4836C5F28045C1B9BEFCF78284FA42.description:
Educators develop activities that match each student’s developmental
level and culture-based learning needs.

99645942D31B4FE1B5C19E914D98D9C6.description:
Self-Understanding - Students with gifts and
talents possess a developmentally appropriate
understanding of how they learn and grow; they
recognize the influences of their beliefs, traditions,
and values on their learning and behavior.

648261D4D9E64A41BE2B02FAD17C1950.description:
Educators assist students with gifts and talents in developing identities
supportive of achievement.

719854F59BEA43E0A99B04A51A094E8B.description:
Educators engage students with gifts and talents in identifying interests,
strengths, and gifts

BB13BD5A52634F7DABD3EE0775AB4F73.description:
Self-Understanding - Students with gifts and
talents demonstrate self-knowledge with respect to
their interests, strengths, identities, and needs in
socio-emotional development and in intellectual,
academic, creative, leadership, and artistic
domains.
